name: deimosrising
text: First Todd, first frikkin' awesome, first 'sploded. A trip through the archives is like a trip through history except I didn't major in it and I don't regret it.

text: It seems unnatural for Todd to be talking about actual sustenance instead of smack.

text: I love the childish-ness of the "I found 12 acorns!" line and how excited he is and then the agressiveness that follows quickly after.

text: Verily.

text: The subtle change of Todd's posture in the last panel makes it for me.

text: well it wasn't a Body so much as it was a brown scrap of fur surrounded by a messy halo of dirt-flecked entrails. but still man, show some respect.

text: todd is the first character to have a "voice"

name: life_is_good
text:
in art class in grade 8, a friend wrote "sploded" on one of my pieces, i thought he invented it and was captivated by the word
now i know better, and hate that guy

text: tod is amazing.

text: I think it's due to this strip that I commonly use 'exploded' as a transitive verb.

text: I think we all need more transitive verbs in our life.

text: I love the all-black design of Todd.

text: I agree with Teodor: dead squirrel bodies aren't like real dead bodies. Even if they are 'sploded.

text: He was 'sploded by a car - he didn't notice that the lights had changed.

text: a crowd of people stood and stared

name: sparhawk
text: Enter Todd: The Saddest Thing.

name: bill4935
text: That picture of Todd in the first panel was my avatar on many a message board.

name: deusoma
text: And yet not this message board, which deals with Todd. Interesting.

name: ryanfuss
text: I think Frankie was splattered for pinching acorns from the crop, like a greedy bastard. Good phorensics on the part of Todd too. Top class corpse identification.

name: ham_shoes
text: Todd goes from ecstatic to tragic in the first three panels, and by the sixth settles on just plain old not caring.

name: lamboyster
text: I didn't like a lot of Achewood characters when I first read Achewood. After all these years, Todd is the only one left who I feel anything but unconditional love for. It's like all the negative perceptions I've had for anyone else just drained into Todd, and he represents a black well of hatred to me.

name: notgodot
text: Am I the only one that imagines Todd sounding like a douchebag from Jersey?

name: mrchuckletrouzd
text:
Shit. I forgot that Todd doesn't change with time either.

I've made a fool of myself, and the things which I say make me deserve ostracizing.


no.


perhaps that is too much.
